content.data: The  Report.Mdb  file contains cut list and summary data for a job. This database is unique in that most of its data is temporary. When either the Bid Center or Report Center buttons are selected from within CABINET VISION most Tables within Report.mdb are flushed and re-populated.
The following is the breakdown of the tables and their fields:
This Table stores the Accessories used in the Job.

rows: A unique number to reference the Accessory.
A cross-reference to the [Cabinets].[Cabinet ID] if the Accessory is attached to a Cabinet. If the Accessory is not attached to a Cabinet, the value for this field is 0.
The .CVC file (Catalog) this Accessory originated from.
The [Assembly].[AssemblyID] from the [ACatalog Name] for this accessory.
The [Assembly].[Signature] from the [ACatalog Name] for this Accessory.
The [PriceLabels].[PriceID] from the [ACatalog Name] for this Accessory.
The List Price for this Accessory.
The setting for the [Styles].[StyleID] from the [ACatalog Name] when this Accessory was placed in the Job.
The order this Accessory appears in a Cabinet.
The Percent Up charge attached to this Accessory.
A cross-reference to the [Rooms].[RoomNumber] linking this record to it’s Room.
Stores the Accessory List from the Catalog.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the Accessory is a Finished product.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the Accessory is Priced by the Square Foot.
The Width of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Height of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Depth of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Labor for this Accessory in Minutes.

content.data: A unique number to reference the Accessory.
A cross-reference to the [Cabinets].[Cabinet ID] if the Accessory is attached to a Cabinet. If the Accessory is not attached to a Cabinet, the value for this field is 0.
The .CVC file (Catalog) this Accessory originated from.
The [Assembly].[AssemblyID] from the [ACatalog Name] for this accessory.
The [Assembly].[Signature] from the [ACatalog Name] for this Accessory.
The [PriceLabels].[PriceID] from the [ACatalog Name] for this Accessory.
The List Price for this Accessory.
The setting for the [Styles].[StyleID] from the [ACatalog Name] when this Accessory was placed in the Job.
The order this Accessory appears in a Cabinet.
The Percent Up charge attached to this Accessory.
A cross-reference to the [Rooms].[RoomNumber] linking this record to it’s Room.
Stores the Accessory List from the Catalog.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the Accessory is a Finished product.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the Accessory is Priced by the Square Foot.
The Width of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Height of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Depth of this Accessory in its User entered Unit of Measure.
The Labor for this Accessory in Minutes.
This Table stores your Bid Methods/Rate Tables.

rows: A unique number to reference this Bid Method/Rate Table.
A short name for this Bid Method/Rate Table.
The Description of this Bid Method/Rate Table.
A number indicating what Icon to display for any line items using this Bid Method/Rate Table.

Bit Flag that indicates where the Bid Method appears in Bid Center Setup: 
 (0x01) = Custom 
 (0x02) = Labor 
 (0x04) = Lite 
 (0x08) = Stock
Determines the order of the Bid Methods in the Combo Box.

content.data: A unique number to reference this Bid Method/Rate Table.
A short name for this Bid Method/Rate Table.
The Description of this Bid Method/Rate Table.
A number indicating what Icon to display for any line items using this Bid Method/Rate Table.
Bit Flag that indicates where the Bid Method appears in Bid Center Setup:
Determines the order of the Bid Methods in the Combo Box.
This Table stores the Bid Setup used in the Job.

rows: A cross-reference to the [Bids].[Bid ID] field indicating what Bid this line item is for.
The Description for this line item.
The Price for this line item.
A cross-reference to the [Bid Methods].[Method ID] field indicating what Method to use when Pricing this line item.
The percent of Markup for this line item.
The percent of Tax for this line item
A unique number for referencing this line item.

The name of the Group this line item is a part of. If this field has a value all line items for a Group will be subtotaled and listed under that Group name.  If set to " " this line item will not be associated with a Group.
The name of the Sub-Group this line item is a part of. If set to " " this line item will not be associated with a Sub-Group.
Determines the Order the Bid Line Item’s appear in the View.
The Icon to use for the Bid Method.
The Icon to use for the Group.
The Icon used for the Sub-Group.

content.data: A cross-reference to the [Bids].[Bid ID] field indicating what Bid this line item is for.
The Description for this line item.
The Price for this line item.
A cross-reference to the [Bid Methods].[Method ID] field indicating what Method to use when Pricing this line item.
The percent of Markup for this line item.
The percent of Tax for this line item
A unique number for referencing this line item.

The name of the Group this line item is a part of. If this field has a value all line items for a Group will be subtotaled and listed under that Group name.  If set to " " this line item will not be associated with a Group.
The name of the Sub-Group this line item is a part of. If set to " " this line item will not be associated with a Sub-Group.
Determines the Order the Bid Line Item’s appear in the View.
The Icon to use for the Bid Method.
The Icon to use for the Group.
The Icon used for the Sub-Group.
This Table ties the Accessories to the Bid.

rows: A cross-reference to the [Bids].[Bid ID] field.
A cross-reference to the [Accessories].[Access ID] field.

content.data: A cross-reference to the [Bids].[Bid ID] field.
A cross-reference to the [Accessories].[Access ID] field.
This table is currently not used.

rows: A cross-reference to the [Bids].[Bid ID] field - Currently Not Used
A cross-reference to the [tbl Material].[ID] field in Material.cvm - Currently Not Used

This table stores the Bid Report Groups.

rows: A unique number used to reference the Report Group.
The name of the Report Group.

content.data: A unique number used to reference the Report Group.
The name of the Report Group.
This table stores the Bid Report Lists.
This table stores the Bid Reports.

rows: A unique number to reference the Report.
A short unique identifier for system reports.
A short Name for the Report.
A global unique reference to the report
A boolean field set true if the report is system report and can not be edited.
Saves last printer this report was sent to.  It will use saved printer if available when printing this report from a report group

content.data: A unique number to reference the Report.
A short unique identifier for system reports.
A short Name for the Report.
A global unique reference to the report
A boolean field set true if the report is system report and can not be edited.
Saves last printer this report was sent to.  It will use saved printer if available when printing this report from a report group
This table stores general Rate Table information.

rows: A unique number used to reference the Bid.
A Boolean flag set true indicates use all Accessories in the Bid.  If set false – only uses the Accessories listed in the [Bid Setup Accessories] table.
A Boolean flag set true indicates to itemize the accessories - Currently Not Used
A Boolean flag set true indicates use all Materials for pricing. If set false – only use the Materials listed in the [Bid Setup Materials] table.
A Boolean flag set true will display an itemized cost for all Materials in the Job for this bid.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the bid is for a Labor Estimate.
Indicates the Bid Method was designed/used by Autograph.

content.data: A unique number used to reference the Bid.
A Boolean flag set true indicates use all Accessories in the Bid.  If set false – only uses the Accessories listed in the [Bid Setup Accessories] table.
A Boolean flag set true indicates to itemize the accessories - Currently Not Used
A Boolean flag set true indicates use all Materials for pricing. If set false – only use the Materials listed in the [Bid Setup Materials] table.
A Boolean flag set true will display an itemized cost for all Materials in the Job for this bid.
A Boolean flag set true indicates the bid is for a Labor Estimate.
Indicates the Bid Method was designed/used by Autograph.
This table stores all the Cabinets and their general information for this Job.

rows: The Room Number for this Cabinet.
The Wall Number for this Cabinet.
The Width of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Width in the display unit.
The Height of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Height in the display unit.
The Depth of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Depth in the display unit.
Image of the Cabinet - Currently Not Used

A numeric value indicating the type of Cabinet: 
 1 = Base 
 2 = Upper 
 3 = Tall 
 4 = Vanity 
 5 = Appliance 
 6 = Accessory 
 7 = Decorative 
 8 = Top 
 9 = Molding 
 10 = Wall 
 11 = Wall Face 
 12 = Floor 
 13 = Ceiling 
 14 = Door 
 15 = Non-Graphic Accessory 
 16 = Splash 
 17 = User Light 
 18 = Fixture 
 19 = Bath 
 20 = Planit - Currently Not Used 
 21 = Closet 
 22 = Closet Base 
 23 = Closet Upper

A numeric value indicating the style of the cabinet: 
 1 = Standard 
 2 = Blind Right 
 3 = Blind Left 
 4 = Corner 45 
 5 = Corner 90 
 6 = Filler 
 7 = Desk 
 8 = Hood 
 9 = Refer 
 10 = Valance 
 11 = UCValance 
 12 = Appliance Garage 
 13 = Dish Washer 
 14 = Trash Comp 
 15 = Range 
 16 = Cook Top 
 17 = Sink 
 18 = Microwave 
 19 = Window 
 20 = Entry Door 
 21 = Picture
The Left Scribe Width for the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Left Scribe Width in the display unit.
The Right Scribe Width of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Right Scribe Width in the display unit.
The Left End type (Finished, Unfinished, Extended, etc.)
The Right End type (Finished, Unfinished, Extended, etc.)
The Toe Height of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Toe Height in the display unit.
The Toe Recess of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Toe Recess in the display unit.
The Soffit Height of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Soffit Height in the display unit.
The Elevation of the Cabinet in imperial units.
The string representation of the Cabinet Elevation in the display unit.
The amount of exposed area for the Cabinet.
The Assembly Labor associated with this Cabinet.
Any Additional Labor associated with the Cabinet.
The square total of the Cabinet’s Face.
A boolean flag set true if the cabinet was selected from a Retail catalog
A Boolean flag set true if the Cabinet is a Stock Cabinet. If true, additional information about the Cabinet will be stored in the [Stock Cabinets] table.
Any Price attached to the Cabinet. (Price field in Cabinet Properties)
Any Comment attached to the Cabinet.

A short string indicating the Door Hinge placement: 
 L = Left 
 R = Right 
 T = Top 
 B = Bottom 
 N = None

Stores Standard Assembly Data: 
 CONM = Construction Style 
 LRVL = Left Reveal String Value 
 TRVL = Top Reveal String Value 
 BRVL = Bottom Reveal String Value 
 HRVL = Horizontal Reveal String Value 
 VRVL = Vertical Reveal String Value 
 TOEH = Toe Height String Value 
 TOER =  Toe Recess String Value
The .CVC File (Catalog) this Cabinet originated from.
A reference to the [Assembly].[AssemblyID] field from this object's .CVC file.

This Table stores general information about this Database.

rows: A number indicating the version of this Database. The Database Version changes each time fields are added/removed from the Database.

This table stores all the Doors and their general information for this Job.

rows: A unique number to reference the Door.
A cross-reference to the [Cabinets].[Cabinet ID] field indicating what Cabinet this Door is attached to.
A cross-reference to the [Doors].[ID] field indicating the Door Style.

A short string indicating the Door Type: 
 S = Single Door 
 P = This is one Door of a Pair of Doors.

A short string indicating the Door Hinge placement: 
 L = Left 
 R = Right 
 T = Top 
 B = Bottom 
 N = None.
The Width of the Door in imperial units.
The string representation of the Door Width in the display unit.
The Height of the Door in imperial units.
The string representation of the Door Height in the display unit.

The name of the Edge Profile.

The name of the Raised Panel Detail Profile.

The name of the Route Pattern Profile.

An image of the door - Currently Not Used
Indicates in what direction the [Hinge Center Lines] are referenced.
Indicates the centerlines of the Hinges for this Door.
Indicates which Mounting Holes the base plates for the Hinges will be mounted on.
The amount of Labor, in minutes associated with this Door.
Cost as associated with this Door in the Door Catalog.
A cross-reference to [Drawers].[Drawer ID] if the Door is a Drawer Front.
The quantity of Pulls on this Door.
The quantity of Hinges on this Door.

Number indicating Door Class: 
 1 = Base Door 
 2 = Drawer Front 
 3 = Upper Door
Contains the notes for the Door entered in the Door Catalog.
Indicates whether this Door is set to use Horizontal Grain.
Indicates if this Door is being used as an End Panel.
The catalog the door originated from.
A number to assist in identifying the version of the distributable door catalog
Text indicator to identify door/drawer and it's position in the Assembly.
A cross-reference to the [tbl Material].[ID] field indicating what material the hinge is built from.

This table is for internal use.

This table will contain either the Waste from the Material Catalog or the Waste recalculated using the area of the parts and the number of sheets used in Optimization. The waste values will change anytime a filter is applied. Since we are adjusting the Waste Factor the material totals per cabinet will be in a ratio to the number of sheets used (not an even number of sheets). You can get the number of sheets for a single cabinet by applying a filter for that cabinet (or any combination).

rows: A cross-reference to the [tbl Material].[ID] field in Material.cvm
An override to the waste percent from material.cvm based on the material usage from the generic Optimizer

content.data: A cross-reference to the [tbl Material].[ID] field in Material.cvm
An override to the waste percent from material.cvm based on the material usage from the generic Optimizer

rows: A cross-reference to the [Cabinets].[Cabinet ID] that this Part is attached to.
A unique number for referencing the Part.
The Width of the Part in imperial units.
The string representation of the Part Width in the display unit.
The Length of the Part in imperial units.

A series of bit flags indicating a Part is being Banded and/or Laminated and where: 
 0x01 = Edge Band Width of Part 
 0x02 = Edge Band Width of Part x2 
 0x04 = Edge Band Length of Part 
 0x08 = Edge Band Length of Part x2 
 0x10 = Laminate Face of Part 
 0x20 = Laminate Back of Part

The number of Holes on this Part.

This table stores any Report  Tables  that have been created.

rows: A unique ID to reference this variable
An optional connection string defining the data provider and how to connect to the data store
A fully qualified path to the data source or a source variable. Examples: c:\junk\mydata.mdb, [CxMaterials], [DBPath]psnc-cv.mdb, [DBPath]Generic.cvc
Name for the table or dataset
An optional SQL statment to gather the data. If blank it will default to SELECT * FROM [TableName]
An optional field used to filter data by CabinetID.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Cabinets.[Cabinet ID]
An option field used to filter Counter Top data.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Tops.[Top ID]
An optional field used to filter data by room.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Room.RoomNumer
An optional field used to filter splash parts.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Parts.[Part ID]
An optional field used for Manage-IT reports to filter the data by a single account.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field
An optional list of fields in the order of how they should be sorted. Example:  [Material ID] ASC, Width DESC, Length DESC
An optional comma delimited list of fields that exist in the SQL statement that sorting can be applied to.  Leave blank for none or * for all
A SQL statement for gathering Cabinet (Quantity) data.  Alternately you could also use Parts, Doors, Drawers or Rollouts for one of the default SQL statements
A value other that 0 will provide a rip summary.  The unit should be 1=in, 12=ft, 36=yard, [1/25.4]0.0393700787401575=mm, [1/25400]39.37007874015748=meter
An optional SQL statement to gather information for the comment list.  A value of 1 would use the default method to gather data or you can specify a customer SQL statement
An optional format for the comment list.  The default is: Cab #{Cabinet} - {Comment}
Field name in dataset that will be linked to by foreign data
Field name in foreign data that links to ConcatRelatedPrimary
Table name where ConcatRelatedForeign is found
Field to be concatenated. When this is specified, the data in that field is created, then a new line would be created, then the next record... so on and so forth
An optional formatted string used to format the ConcatRelatedField.  If blank the default would be {Field}\n\r

content.data: A unique ID to reference this variable
An optional connection string defining the data provider and how to connect to the data store
A fully qualified path to the data source or a source variable. Examples: c:\junk\mydata.mdb, [CxMaterials], [DBPath]psnc-cv.mdb, [DBPath]Generic.cvc
Name for the table or dataset
An optional SQL statment to gather the data. If blank it will default to SELECT * FROM [TableName]
An optional field used to filter data by CabinetID.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Cabinets.[Cabinet ID]
An option field used to filter Counter Top data.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Tops.[Top ID]
An optional field used to filter data by room.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Room.RoomNumer
An optional field used to filter splash parts.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field and represent the Parts.[Part ID]
An optional field used for Manage-IT reports to filter the data by a single account.  The name of the field must exist in the SQL field
An optional list of fields in the order of how they should be sorted. Example:  [Material ID] ASC, Width DESC, Length DESC
An optional comma delimited list of fields that exist in the SQL statement that sorting can be applied to.  Leave blank for none or * for all
A SQL statement for gathering Cabinet (Quantity) data.  Alternately you could also use Parts, Doors, Drawers or Rollouts for one of the default SQL statements
A value other that 0 will provide a rip summary.  The unit should be 1=in, 12=ft, 36=yard, [1/25.4]0.0393700787401575=mm, [1/25400]39.37007874015748=meter
An optional SQL statement to gather information for the comment list.  A value of 1 would use the default method to gather data or you can specify a customer SQL statement
An optional format for the comment list.  The default is: Cab #{Cabinet} - {Comment}
Field name in dataset that will be linked to by foreign data
Field name in foreign data that links to ConcatRelatedPrimary
Table name where ConcatRelatedForeign is found
Field to be concatenated. When this is specified, the data in that field is created, then a new line would be created, then the next record... so on and so forth
An optional formatted string used to format the ConcatRelatedField.  If blank the default would be {Field}\n\r
